Rakesh, 30-yrs has marked swelling on palmar aspect of the wrist. Persistent flexion of fingers and apparent shortening of middle finger is seen. Sensation over palm is normal. Partial flexion of fingers in this case is best explained by which of the following?
opb: Compression of the recurrent bra ich of the median nerve
opc: Impingement of the flexor tendons by a dislocated carpal bone
opd: Paralysis of the dorsal interossei muscles
